cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 183 (Tuesday, December 10, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. MILLER:H.R. 10345.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8The single subject of this legislation is:veterans[Page H6801]

item.title: Hershel ‘Woody’ Williams State Committal Shelter Act of 2024

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

bill.title: Hershel Woody Williams State Committal Shelter Act of 2024

item.title: Hershel Woody Williams State Committal Shelter Act of 2024
Hershel Woody Williams State Committal Shelter Act of 2024
To require the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to carry out a program for the construction and renovation of committal shelters at State-owned veterans' cemeteries, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
